Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup; interior glazed black; exterior: band at lip/bowl join; in handle zone black-figure decoration consisting of male figure reclining to left (back of man's head with added red hair with red cushion behind him and part of couch below).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 379, no. B529)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0376) (Phase 1)
